Package com.aeonium.javafx.validation.annotations

This package contains the default validation constraint annotations of the framework: FXNotNull, FXRequired, FXString, FXNumber and FXValidation for using custom validator classes.

See: Description

  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    FXNotNull
    Marks a selection control, e.g., ChoiceBox, as not allowed to have a null value.
    FXNumber
    Marks a text input field as numeric input.
    FXRequired
    Mark a text-input field as required, i.e., it must have a non-empty input string.
    FXString
    Define constraints for a string input field, e.g., minimum length and/or maximum length.
    FXValidation
    Use this annotation for applying custom validation to a control: Implement a custom validator class (derived from FXAbstractValidator) and assign it's class with the FXValidation.validation() attibute of this annotation.
    FXValidationChecked
    This annotation marks a control or BooleanProperty that's enabled state is bound to the validation results of the validation constraints in the same scene.

Package com.aeonium.javafx.validation.annotations Description

This package contains the default validation constraint annotations of the framework: FXNotNull, FXRequired, FXString, FXNumber and FXValidation for using custom validator classes.
